page.title: 17TRANSPORT.
page.content: Although the Northolt {Airbase dominates much of the area, the main modes of transport used are road, rail (and foot!). The {A40 / Western Avenue}crosses the survey area from west to east. Local traffic can join it at one point in the study area: the junction with West End Road in the easternmost "middle" square. Most of the other roads are smaller local ones that lead to the different areas of housing. There are three stations in the area. Ickenham, Ruislip Gardens and South Ruislip are stations on the{London {Underground}(although these tracks are out in the open air). They are all on the{Metropolitan}and{Piccadilly}lines. They take workers into central London every morning during the{"rush hour". South Ruislip is also a{British Rail station.
